div.h3:
Ember Lottery 2020
April 6th 2020 – 5pm
Live Stream Link: https://youtu.be/VkzS1mRJIGU
We’re Creating the nation’s first K-12 University.

div.p: Ember Charter Schools is a holistic learning environment modeled after the traditional style of university academia. We’ll employ high quality, published educators spanning multiple campuses equipped top technology. The result will be engaged students preparing for their roles as tomorrow’s leaders.

Students will begin their studies in our progressive, holistic and culturally responsive elementary school program for grades K-4, where they will lay a strong foundation for developing agency, critical thinking and positive self identity.

The middle school experience will span grades 5-8, with students moving into single-sex cohorts for grades 7 and 8. Students will also have an opportunity for a unique opportunity to study abroad in Ghana with Ember teachers and staff during grades 7 and 8.

Ember plans to continue their program up through high school for grades 9-12, with students continuing in single-sex cohorts and deepening their study of integrated subjects through the rigorous but holistic International Baccalaureate curriculum.

blockquote.p: Our goal at Ember is to nurture students into social entrepreneurs, engineers and global leaders. We guide their direction, but in the end, they’re the ones paving their own path.
No child should be labeled “at-risk” simply because of socioeconomic status or access to opportunity. We strip this label, letting our students succeed without limits.
We believe all children should be given the opportunity to reach their potential. At Ember, we’ll let give them the right tools to become the leaders we know they can be.
We’re the first school to use a Teaching Firm model to transform traditionally “at-risk” students into social entrepreneurs, engineers and global leaders for today and into the future.
Our school is unlike any other in the City, we’re the first teacher-led model and the first black-led charter school; we focus on serving historically under-resourced, low income communities.
We’re creating the nation’s first K-12 university to give our students a transformational approach to education, helping them grow into the community leaders we know they can be.

h2.strong: Formerly "Teaching Firms of America-Professional Preparatory Charter Schools", Ember Charter Schools for Mindful Education, Innovation and Transformation seek to use our innovative K-12 university school model to ignite, empower and transform people traditionally labeled “at-risk” into powerful social entrepreneurs, engineers, and global leaders.

Our school is driven by our innovative Teaching Firm, a unique teacher-led organizational model, designed to deliver a fun, holistic, ‘college-successful’, career-ready, community-centered, culturally rich and relevant learning experience, where we ignite and empower the mindsets of the people we serve to nurture social justice and positively change the world .

div.p: Our model purposely rejects the 'no-excuses' approach in favor of a focus on holistic human development. By nurturing student agency, critical thinking, cultural fluency, executive functioning and social emotional skills, we enable our students to grow consistently and significantly each year. In short, the longer they are with us the greater their achievement, all accomplished without rigid test prep or a shame-based discipline policy. Empowerment, not fear is our most powerful tool to ignite transformation.

div.p: Ember’s mission is to transform, empower and ignite the potential of students who have traditionally been labeled “at-risk” from historically underserved, under-resourced, low income communities.

We will serve the Black and Latino children of Bedford Stuyvesant-Central Brooklyn. This demographic represents some of the poorest children in the nation, which remain disconnected from high quality, holistic and comprehensive education options.

Ember will provide private school quality education in a public school setting, giving our students an expansive progressive, holistic and global education typically reserved for children who attend selective public and private independent schools.
